course.name: Starter flow: 15-minute quick-and-easy, all-over supple and strength set
course.description: Short revitalizing sequence combining dynamic flows and gentle stretches, ideal for warm-ups or quick energy resets.

sequence.transition_notes: Flow through 3 cycles: Inhale arch, exhale round. Keep movements fluid
Alternate sides: Hold 3 breaths per side. Keep back knee lowered
Dynamic hip opener: 3 pulses per side. Use hands-on-thigh for support
Perform: 1) Eagle arms 2) Reverse prayer 3) Clasped forward fold (30s each)
Alternate sides: Guide knee across body with exhale. Keep shoulders grounded
Sit upright with cushion support. Focus on natural breath rhythm

course.name: Starter flow: complete 20-minute mini yoga practice for all ages and abilities
course.description: Gentle full-body sequence emphasizing mobility and relaxation, adaptable for any time of day.

sequence.transition_notes: Standing flow: Inhale arms up, exhale sweep down. Maintain soft knees
Alternate sides: Hold bow 3 breaths. Keep hips stacked
5 reps/side: Pulse hips forward on exhale. Use blanket under knee
5/side: Circle arms backward with controlled movement
Modified flow: Step back/forward. Skip Chaturanga for knee-down option
Alternate sides: Place hand on outer knee. Gaze over shoulder
Supine position with legs elevated on bolster. Eye pillow optional

course.name: Power Flow
course.description: Dynamic sequence using Three-Legged Dog transitions between standing postures, emphasizing strength and balance with Ocean Breath. Includes peak poses and cool-down.

sequence.transition_notes: Begin seated, focus on spinal articulation. Use 5-8 deep Ocean Breaths.
Maintain 3-second holds in Plank/Chaturanga. Sync with Ocean Breath (inhale up dog/exhale down dog)
Left leg lift: Engage glutes, keep hips square. Transition to lunge on exhale.
Left side: Hold crescent lunge 3 breaths. Flow through 3 cycles per side.
Right leg lift: Maintain neutral pelvis. Move to lunge with control.
Right side: Keep front knee at 90°. Use arm sweep to maintain balance.
Neutral reset: Check hand-foot alignment before transitioning
Each side: Rotate chest upward, 5 breaths per side. Modify with block if needed
Prepare for Standing Splits: Engage core before lifting leg
Hold 3 breaths per side. Focus on hamstring release over height
Transition to Eagle: Keep shoulders relaxed
3 breaths standing, 3 breaths folded. Unwind slowly
5 breaths per side. Keep heels grounded
Flow continuously: 6 cycles total (3 per direction)
Hold 5 breaths per rep. Engage glutes to protect lower back
2-minute hold per side. Use bolster for support if needed
Pulse hips upward on exhale. Keep neck relaxed
Controlled lifts: 3 seconds up, 3 seconds down
30-second hold per variation. Support sacrum with hands
3-minute hold. Use folded blankets for neck support
Gentle rotations: 8 circles each direction
2.5 minutes total (75s per side). Focus on diaphragmatic breathing
30 seconds per side. Modify with ankle cross if needed
1.5 minutes per side. Use strap for hamstring modification
Full-body scan: 5 minutes supine with eye pillow
Seated meditation: Focus on Ocean Breath rhythm

course.name: supple and strong flow
course.description: A Yang sequence blending Sun Salutations with strength postures, using Dog-Pose Split transitions to integrate flowing movements. Focuses on core engagement and bilateral balance.

sequence.transition_notes: Roll shoulders back after release, transition to cross-legged position for Sun Salute prep
Modified flow: 5 breaths per cycle. Transition via downward dog with bent knees
Left leg lift: Hips square, transition to lunge on exhale
Maintain bind while rotating chest upward, step back to downward dog
Right leg lift: Keep shoulders over wrists, engage lower abdominals
Ground through outer back foot, transition via vinyasa flow
Left leg lift: Prep for revolved pose by twisting torso slightly
Alternate sides: Stack hips, use block under hand if needed
Right then left: Maintain neutral pelvis, transition through tabletop position
Release grip slowly, lower leg with control to mountain pose
Use wall support if needed, transition via forward fold
Engage mula bandha for lift, land with soft elbows
Alternate forearm/high plank: Keep navel drawn upward
Unthread slowly, reset in tabletop before switching sides
Alternate variations every 15 seconds, press pubic bone down
Unwind twist gradually, return to center with chin parallel to floor
Support thigh with strap, transition via gentle leg circles
Exit via controlled tuck roll, immediately move to child's pose
Perform seated chin tucks before reclining twists
Progress through 3 arm positions: T-shape, bent elbow, overhead
Use vishnu mudra, transition to savasana with prolonged exhalations
Elevate legs on bolster, place sandbag over abdomen
Sit upright with spine elongated, hands in chin mudra

course.name: energy and balance
course.description: Grounding sequence combining martial arts-inspired breathwork with dynamic balancing postures. Focuses on hip-shoulder integration and energy channeling using Ocean Breath.

sequence.transition_notes: Flow between Chair and Mountain Pose: Inhale to rise, exhale to sink. Keep knees tracking over toes. Transition via Uttanasana (Forward Fold) for spinal decompression
Alternate sides: On exhale, lower back knee to transition. Keep front heel grounded. Use hand-on-thigh support for hip alignment
Add spinal twist in Down Dog: Lift R hand to L ankle on inhale, return on exhale. Alternate sides each rep. Maintain shoulder stability
Sync breath to arm sweeps: Inhale arms up, exhale into Warrior. Transition via Plank Pose between sides for core activation
Unwind arms slowly on exhale. Transition via Tadasana (Mountain) with shoulder rolls. Alternate wrapped arm positions each side
Step back foot 6" wider for stability. Transition via low lunge. Use block under hands if hamstrings tighten

sequence.pose: Deep Forward Bend at the Wall
sequence.transition_notes: Walk hands up wall to exit. Bend knees slightly before stepping back. Use wall pressure to deepen hamstring release
Guide top knee across body with exhale. Exit via Tabletop Position. Use blanket under hip if needed
Engage transverse abdominals during transitions. For advanced: Add knee-to-nose tuck during Plank phase
Transition from Pigeon to Crescent: Inhale sweep arms up, exhale sink into lunge. Keep back knee lowered for stability
Cycle through variations: 1) Static hold 2) Rocking motion 3) Single-leg lift. Transition via Cobra Pose between reps
Walk hands to R/L sides to stretch obliques before rising. Use bolster under torso for restorative option
Initiate from pelvic floor on exhale. Articulate each vertebra. Use wall support behind back if needed
Place opposite hand on outer knee for leverage. Gaze over shoulder. Transition via neutral spine position between sides
Use wall for support: Walk feet up gradually. Exit via controlled tuck roll. Follow with Wrist Stretches
Rock side-to-side to release sacrum. Transition via gentle log roll to supine position. Modify with strap around arches
Incorporate Jin Shin Jyutsu hand positions: R hand on forehead, L on belly. Visualize energy circulating through meridians
Transition via Sukhasana (Easy Seat) with hip elevation. Use Gyan mudra. Focus on third eye during Ocean Breath retention

course.name: stretch and restore
course.description: Blends active yang stretches with restorative holds. Uses props for deep release in forward bends and inversions.

sequence.transition_notes: Flow between gentle backbends on 4-count Rectangular Breath (inhale 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4). Transition to standing neutral spine.
Lateral flow sequence: Step wide, arc arms overhead to side. Return via forward fold. Mirror opposite side.
From Down Dog: Thread right knee to left elbow, then left knee to right elbow. Reset in neutral Down Dog between twists.
Standing side bends: Root through feet, alternate sides fluidly. Use momentum from previous bend.
From Warrior II: Fold forward into bound angle. Release bind first before transitioning sides.
Repeat earlier pattern. Sync sway speed with Ocean Breath rhythm.
From Side Angle: Grasp top foot, arch back. Release foot first, then lower torso.
Interlace hands behind back, fold. Bend knees slightly to transition out.
Sit slowly with bolster support. Use hands to guide knees downward.
From seated: Rotate pelvis to guide leg position. Alternate sides via neutral spine reset.
Seated spinal waves: Sweep arms up/down in prayer. Flow directly into next sweep.
Pulse hips forward 3x per cycle. Place hands on sacrum when exiting.
Supine spiral: Lead with knee, then ribcage. Untwist completely before switching.
Log-roll to side. Place bolster along concave curve of body.
Slide leg forward with hands. Exit by pressing into palms, tuck back toes.
Use chair/bolster. Fold torso onto prop, then slide hands to floor to exit.
Elevate hips on folded blanket. Slide legs up wall one at a time.
Place sandbag on feet. Roll head gently side-to-side before stillness.
Shift to cross-legged position. Place hands in Anjali mudra at heart.

course.name: clear and calm
course.description: A balanced fusion of Yin long-hold postures and gentle Yang flows to release tension, improve joint mobility, and cultivate mental clarity. Integrates Taoist meridian principles with modern fascial release techniques.

sequence.transition_notes: From seated, press soles together. Use blocks under knees if needed. Transition to forward fold by walking hands forward gradually
Modified flow: Step back to plank instead of jumping. Sync breath to movement (inhale upward, exhale fold)
Alternate sides: Lower back knee slowly. Use folded blanket under knee cap for support
Transition from lunge: Ground back foot at 45°, sweep arms overhead with inhale
From warrior II: Rotate palms upward, draw imaginary energy ball toward chest. Step back to downward dog between sides
Seated pulses: Roll shoulders back on inhale, forward on exhale. Maintain neutral spine
From standing: Hinge at hips, bend knees generously. Release head/neck completely
From supine: Press soles together, knees out. Lift hips slowly with pelvic floor engagement
Prone transition: Walk elbows forward incrementally to find edge. Keep shoulders away from ears
From supine: Grab outer feet, rock gently side-to-side before settling
Side-lying transition: Stack knees/ankles, reach overhead arm in slow arc
Tabletop transition: Thread needle with controlled arm rotation. Alternate sides smoothly
From prone: Slide knees apart incrementally. Support inner thighs with rolled towels if needed
Kneeling transition: Walk hands back toward heels to decompress spine
Supine transition: Place weighted sandbags on feet/shoulders for grounding if available
Seated transition: Elevate hips on bolster for spinal elongation. Use mudra of choice
